related.description: Apollo Tyres Ltd. (APTY) rose to its highest in at least 22 years in Mumbai trading after Cooper Tire & Rubber Co. (CTB) dropped a $2.5 billion merger plan, easing investor concern the Indian company would take on too much debt. Shares of Apollo climbed 5.8 percent to 107.20 rupees, the highest close since at least January 1991.
related.title: Apollo Tyres Climbs After Cooper Tire Drops Merger Plan

title: Two arrested in tuition protest at Cooper Union in Manhattan's East Village
content:
Sam Costanza for New York Daily News

Jesse Kreuzer waves sign reading "No Tuition, It's Our Mission" as he protests atop the 25-foot-high monument of Peter Cooper at East 7th St. and Cooper Square Wednesday afternoon.

A Cooper Union graduate was arrested Wednesday after he scaled his alma mater's namesake statue in protest over the announcement that the famed institution will start charging tuition for graduate studies.

Jesse Kreuzer, 23, of Baldwin, LI, stood perched atop the Peter Cooper monument outside the school's iconic Foundation Building at Cooper Square for nearly an hour and 40 minutes before he was brought down by police in a cherry picker.

A crowd of about 100 students beat on drums and held signs and banners cheering Kreuzer on, yelling, "Free Jesse Kreuzer!" and "End student debt!"

Kreuzer held a sign during his brief moment in the spotlight that read, "Free tuition it's our mission."

On his way down, Kreuzer - who was led away in cuffs - patted an officer on the back and chatted him up.

"He's a talented artist and we love him," fourth-year architectural student Olivia Ahn, 21, said about Kreuzer.

Kreuzer was hit with charges of reckless endangerment, criminal trespass and obstructing governmental administration, police said.

The demonstration was a show of retaliation against The Cooper Union President Jamshed Bharucha's plan to charge tuition for master's programs starting in 2013. The school has been well-known for providing full scholarships to all its students for a century.

"Cooper Union provides a level of egalitarianism, unparalleled," Ahn said. "We trek here for our free education. We don't have fancy facilities like NYU and Columbia, we come here because it's free."

Cops also arrested Sara Abruna, 23, of Brooklyn, who tried to duck under a taped-off area. She was charged with harassment, disorderly conduct and obstructing governmental administration.

sarmaghan@nydailynews.com

entities.name: New York Daily News Jesse Kreuzer
